content: someone add harder cases so people cant brute force this so much

"You must find the value of two positive integers A and B".
Then how does two positive integers add up to 0?

The best brute-force algorithm has the complexity of O(sqrt(AB)). If you wanted to render the brute-force solution unusable, AB would have to be 10^20, which is around 2^66, which would require an over-64-bit number data structure. It's hard to discard brute-force where the best (non-brute-force) solution is O(1) (like here). I'd say when it comes to CoC, there's no need to ban brute-force if it works. That's why I approve your contribution.

I feel like it is too simple since this is the basic idea of Alpha  Beta discriminant problem. It is easy to just form 2 equations (a+b)^2 and (a-b)^2 and use S and P to solve each so we know what the values are. That being side I think its great for Clash of Code since the whole point of a Clash of Code is to do it the fastest. In this case, I could do it with a single print statement and two formulas:  A is equal to the square root of S to the power of 2 - 4p all of which -2 all of which is over 2. B = square root of S to the power of 2 - 4p all of which +2 all of which over 2.

Hi! First of all, i didn't even need to brute force it to complete all the tests. What you have here is a simple quadratic equation to solve. I solved it with a simple formula and an if statement. I'd increase the bound to prevent brute forcing and provoke a timeOut. It's a nice problem for a clash of code. However, you need some criteria about what the order should of A and B should be. Sum and multiplication are commutative operations so there has to be some care to  be taken there. 
Here you have the formulas to get A and B

    A = (s-math.sqrt(s**2-4*p))/2
    B = p/A

But the output order part is missing though

I can try to prevent brute forcing. That would make it more interesting, and much harder. 
Problem is, I calculated a formula to find A and B, and using it seems to be slower than a for loop, even with way bigger numbers.  That, and depending on the language it may or may not be a better choice for code golf.
Too easy to brute force, why not make it more mathy?

This is my first contribution here, so please tell me if there's something to change.
I wasn't sure if reverse should be included, so I didn't include it for now.
